Back to Franz Liszt

Franz Liszt

Six Études d’exécution transcendante d’après Paganini, S. 140

1838 · LW A52 · R. 3a

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 27' 30"

  • 1. G minor
  • 2. E-flat major
  • 3. A-flat minor
  • 4a. E major
  • 4b. E major
  • 5a. E major
  • 5b. E major
  • 6. A minor

The études are arrangements of works by Nicolò Paganini. The collection also exists in a later version from 1851, the Six Grandes études de Paganini (S. 141; LW A173; R. 3b).

Recommended editions

  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · Suppl. 12 · Z. A/B 14567 · ed. Adrienne Kaczmarczyk [including two album leaves for no. 4b]

1. G minor

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 6) that includes the introduction to another caprice (op. 1 no. 5). In the first edition, Alongside his arrangement, Liszt included Robert Schumann’s arrangement of one of these caprices (op. 1 no. 6), with some very minor alterations.

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 4

2. E-flat major

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 17).

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 5

3. A-flat minor

This is based on themes from the final movements of the first and second violin concerti (opp. 6 and 7). In the 1851 version, Liszt removed the material based on the first concerto. Liszt also uses the theme from the second concerto in his Grande Fantaisie de bravoure sur La Clochette (S. 420; LW A15; R. 231) and Grande Fantaisie sur des thèmes de Paganini (S. 700a/i; LW A113; R. 231 and S. 700a/ii; LW A113; R. 231).

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 5

4a. E major

Liszt gives two versions for this piece, which is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 1).

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 5

4b. E major

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 5

5a. E major

Liszt gives two versions for this piece, which is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 9). The opening bars are identical.

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 4.5

5b. E major

Duration: 4'

Difficulty: 4.5

6. A minor

This is an arrangement of a caprice for solo violin (op. 1 no. 24). In 1884, Liszt wrote a short album leaf that can serve as an introduction to this étude.

Duration: 6'

Difficulty: 5
